title: Skewers (The Burning Line)
coachIntro: First the King runs, then the piece behind him dies.
summary: Learn how to attack the King with a valuable piece behind him, and how to avoid being skewered yourself.

tasks.prompt: Line up the King and Queen on one line and check him. When he runs, take the Queen.
tasks.successMessage: Good. This is the reverse of a pin: first the King runs, then the treasure falls.

tasks.prompt: Use your Bishop to attack the King so that a more valuable piece sits behind him on the diagonal.
tasks.successMessage: Excellent. The diagonal is on fire; he can only save one piece.

tasks.prompt: Find the check that forces his King to move and leaves his Rook hanging behind.
tasks.successMessage: Very good. In endgames, a single skewer on a Rook can decide the game.

tasks.prompt: He wants to put your King and Queen on one burning line. Find the move that avoids the skewer.
tasks.successMessage: Good. You stepped out of the fire instead of standing on the line.

tasks.prompt: Use your Rook to line up his King and pawn so that when the King moves, the pawn falls.
tasks.successMessage: Endgames belong to the player who knows how to use skewers. Well done.
